title: A glimpse at the diversity of Peru's endemic plants
text: ppendemic R package offers convenient access new extensive database containing list 7,249 endemic plant species found Peru. comprehensive collection provides detailed botanical information, including accepted names, family, authorship, publication details, place date first publication species. construction ppendemic package built upon valuable data sourced renowned World Checklist Vascular Plants (WCVP) database. highly authoritative resource, WCVP offers comprehensive information plant taxonomy occurrence worldwide. Leveraging data, ppendemic package aims present --date novel compilation Peru’s endemic plant species, tailored diverse ecosystems region. incorporating meticulously curated data WCVP, package offers users reliable accurate resource explore, analyze, gain deeper insights rich diversity Peru’s endemic flora. Representing significant advancement understanding Peru’s endemic plant species, ppendemic package surpasses previously known list 5,507 species presented Red Book Endemic Plants Peru, bringing total impressive 7,249 species. substantial increase documented endemic species testament integration data commitment presenting --date information. expanded current database, researchers, conservationists, nature enthusiasts alike can now delve comprehensive accurate account Peru’s unique diverse plant biodiversity. ppendemic package stands valuable resource anyone interested study, conservation, appreciation Peru’s endemic plant life. database spans total 169 families, particular richness observed Orchidaceae, Asteraceae, Piperaceae, Solanaceae, Fabaceae, Bromeliaceae, Melastomataceae, Araceae, Rubiaceae, Gentianaceae families, boast highest number endemic species Peru.

title: A glimpse at the diversity of Peru's endemic plants
text: can install ppendemic package GitHub using following command:

title: A glimpse at the diversity of Peru's endemic plants
text: installing ppendemic package, can load R session using: Use is_ppendemic() check taxa endemic is_ppendemic() function designed work seamlessly tibbles, allowing users easily analyze determine endemism status species within tabular format. Utilize get_ppendemic_data() function retrieve comprehensive taxonomic information.
code: library(ppendemic) splist <- c("Aa aurantiaca", "Aa aurantiaaia",             "Werneria nubigena", "Piper politum var. politum",             "Miconia firma") is_ppendemic(splist) #> [1] "Aa aurantiaca is endemic"                  #> [2] "Aa aurantiaca is endemic - fuzzy matching" #> [3] "not endemic"                               #> [4] "not endemic"                               #> [5] "Miconia firma is endemic" tibble::tibble(splist = splist) |>    dplyr::mutate(endemic = is_ppendemic(splist)) #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   splist                     endemic                                   #>   <chr>                      <chr>                                     #> 1 Aa aurantiaca              Aa aurantiaca is endemic                  #> 2 Aa aurantiaaia             Aa aurantiaca is endemic - fuzzy matching #> 3 Werneria nubigena          not endemic                               #> 4 Piper politum var. politum not endemic                               #> 5 Miconia firma              Miconia firma is endemic get_ppendemic_data(splist = splist) #>               name_submitted accepted_name accepted_family accepted_name_author #> 1              Aa aurantiaca Aa aurantiaca     Orchidaceae           D.Trujillo #> 2             Aa aurantiaaia Aa aurantiaca     Orchidaceae           D.Trujillo #> 3          Werneria nubigena          nill            nill                 nill #> 4 Piper politum var. politum          nill            nill                 nill #> 5              Miconia firma Miconia firma Melastomataceae           J.F.Macbr. #>   publication_author                   place_of_publication volume_and_page #> 1               <NA>                          Lankesteriana           11: 3 #> 2               <NA>                          Lankesteriana           11: 3 #> 3               nill                                   nill            nill #> 4               nill                                   nill            nill #> 5               <NA> Publ. Field Mus. Nat. Hist., Bot. Ser.      13(4): 411 #>   first_published dist #> 1          (2011)    0 #> 2          (2011)    2 #> 3            nill nill #> 4            nill nill #> 5          (1941)    0

Vilca Bustamante}, #>     year = {2023}, #>     note = {R package version 0.1.6}, #>     doi = {10.5281/zenodo.5106619}, #>     url = {https://github.com/PaulESantos/ppendemic}, #>   }

text: data frame containing retrieved information species.

title: Retrieve data for a list of species from the ppendemic_tab dataset. — get_ppendemic_data
code: get_ppendemic_data(splist = c("Aa aurantiaca", "Aa aurantiaaia", "werneria nubigena")) #>      name_submitted accepted_name accepted_family accepted_name_author #> 1     Aa aurantiaca Aa aurantiaca     Orchidaceae           D.Trujillo #> 2    Aa aurantiaaia Aa aurantiaca     Orchidaceae           D.Trujillo #> 3 Werneria nubigena          nill            nill                 nill #>   publication_author place_of_publication volume_and_page first_published dist #> 1               <NA>        Lankesteriana           11: 3          (2011)    0 #> 2               <NA>        Lankesteriana           11: 3          (2011)    2 #> 3               nill                 nill            nill            nill nill

title: Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
text: splist character vector containing list species names checked endemism ppendemic database. max_distance numeric value (default 0.1) specifying maximum distance fuzzy matching. non-negative value.

title: Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
text: character vector indicating species endemic, endemic, endemic species found using fuzzy matching.

title: Check if species are endemic in the ppendemic database — is_ppendemic
code: is_ppendemic(c("Aa aurantiaca", "Aa aurantiaaia", "Werneria nubigena")) #> [1] "Aa aurantiaca is endemic"                  #> [2] "Aa aurantiaca is endemic - fuzzy matching" #> [3] "not endemic"

title: ppendemic_tab: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab
ppendemic_tab: Endemic Plant Database of Peru — ppendemic_tab
